title: Law on Organisation, Functioning and Competence of the Council of Pharmacists
title_en: Law on Organisation, Functioning and Competence of the Council of Pharmacists

provisions.chapter: Chapter One – General provisions
provisions.title: Article One – Purpose of this Law
provisions.content: This Law determines organization, functioning and competence of the Council of pharmacists.

provisions.chapter: Chapter One – General provisions
provisions.title: Article 2 – Definitions of terms
provisions.content: Under this Law, the following terms shall have the following meanings: 1° Pharmacist: any person authorized to make or dispense a medicine by virtue of his/her academic qualification; 2° Council: Council of Pharmacists.

provisions.chapter: Chapter One – General provisions
provisions.title: Article 3 – Mission of the Council
provisions.content: The Council shall be responsible for ensuring that the rules, honor and dignity of the pharmacy profession are complied with and ensure the protection of public health. The Council shall ensure compliance with the principles of morality, integrity and dedication essential to the practice of the pharmacy profession and ensure that all its members comply with their professional requirements and the laws and regulations governing pharmacists.

provisions.chapter: Chapter One – General provisions
provisions.title: Article 4 – Competence of the Council
provisions.content: The Council shall have the following competence: 1° to grant and revoke the authorization to practice the pharmacy profession; 2° to provide institutions of higher learning advice with respect to pharmacy academic programs; 3° to take disciplinary measures against pharmacists.

provisions.chapter: Chapter One – General provisions
provisions.title: Article 5 – Autonomy of the Council
provisions.content: The Council shall have legal personality, financial and administrative autonomy.

provisions.chapter: Chapter One – General provisions
provisions.title: Article 6 – Head office of the Council
provisions.content: The head office of the Council shall be located in City of Kigali, the Capital of the Republic of Rwanda. It may be transferred to any other location in Rwanda upon decision by the National Council Board.

provisions.chapter: Chapter II – Organisation of the council
provisions.title: Article 7 – Organs of the Council
provisions.content: The Council shall have the following three (3) organs: 1° the National Council Board; 2° the Bureau of the National Council Board; 3° Technical Committees.

provisions.chapter: Chapter II – Organisation of the council
provisions.title: Article 8 – National Council Board
provisions.content: The National Council Board shall be the supreme organ of the Council.

provisions.chapter: Chapter II – Organisation of the council
provisions.title: Article 9 – Composition of the National Council Board
provisions.content: Members of the National Council Board shall be elected by their peers in each Province and in the City of Kigali on the basis of the number of pharmacists registered in such an area. The internal rules and regulations of the Council shall provide for modalities for their election.

provisions.chapter: Chapter II – Organisation of the council
provisions.title: Article 10 – Term of office of members of the National Council Board
provisions.content: Members of the National Council Board shall serve for a three (3) year term of office renewable only once. They may once again stand for election after five (5) years following the expiry of their previous term of office.

provisions.chapter: Chapter II – Organisation of the council
provisions.title: Article 11 – Grounds for termination of membership in the National Council Board
provisions.content: A person shall cease to be a member of the National Council Board if: 1° his/her term of office expires; 2° he/she resigns in writing; 3° he/she is no longer able to perform his/her duties due to physical or mental disability duly confirmed by an authorized medical doctor; 4° he/she is definitively sentenced to a term of imprisonment equal to or exceeding six (6) months without suspension; 5° he/she misses three (3) consecutive meetings of the National Council Board in a year without justified reasons; 6° he/she jeopardises the interests of the Council; 7° he/she demonstrates behaviors inconsistent with his/her duties; 8° he/she no longer meets the requirements which were considered at the time of his/her election in the National Council Board; 9° he/she confesses and pleads guilty of the crime of genocide; 10° he/she is convicted of the crime of genocide ideology; 11° he/she dies.

provisions.chapter: Chapter II – Organisation of the council
provisions.title: Article 12 – Replacement of a member of the National Council Board
provisions.content: When a member of the National Council Board ceases to be member, he/she shall be replaced within three (3) months under the same conditions as those under which he/she acquired membership. When a member of the National Council Board ceases to be member before the expiry of his/her term, he/she shall be replaced for the remainder of his/her term if such a remainder is more than six (6) months.

provisions.chapter: Chapter II – Organisation of the council
provisions.title: Article 13 – Bureau of the National Council Board
provisions.content: The Bureau of the National Council Board shall be comprised of nine (9) members including a Chairperson and a Deputy Chairperson, a Secretary, a Treasurer and five (5) Advisors. Modalities for their election shall be determined by the internal rules and regulations of the Council.

provisions.chapter: Chapter II – Organisation of the council
provisions.title: Article 14 – Technical Committees
provisions.content: In carrying out its responsibilities, the National Council Board shall be assisted by Technical Committees. The organization and functioning of such Committees shall be determined by the internal rules and regulations of the Council.

provisions.chapter: Chapter II – Organisation of the council
provisions.title: Article 15 – Legal representation
provisions.content: The Council shall carry out its mission through its organs. In legal proceedings and other acts in connection with the fulfillment of its mission, the Council shall be represented by the Chairperson of the National Council Board and, in case of his/her absence, by the Deputy Chairperson.

provisions.chapter: Chapter III – Competence and responsibilities of the organs of the Council
provisions.title: Article 16 – Competence of the National Council Board
provisions.content: The National Council Board establishes internal rules and regulations and general principles relating to morality, honor, confidentiality, dignity and devotion essential to the practice of the profession and which constitute the Code of pharmacy ethics. The National Council Board shall serve as an interlocutor with public and private organs with regard to all matters relating to the pharmacy profession. The National Council Board shall collaborate with all other organs involved in the practice of the medical profession.

provisions.chapter: Chapter III – Competence and responsibilities of the organs of the Council
provisions.title: Article 17 – Responsibilities of the National Council Board
provisions.content: In particular, the National Council Board shall be responsible for the following: 1° to participate in the process of defining the quality of potential procedures expected from a pharmacist and to participate in determining standards for pharmacy education at the university level in Rwanda; 2° to set up regulations on the minimum knowledge and skills required for all pharmacists in their respective categories; 3° to grant and revoke the authorization to practice the pharmacy profession; 4° to set subscription fee required for a member of the Council; 5° to set annual contribution to be paid by each member registered on the Register of members of the Council; 6° to determine the conditions for organizing elections, the procedure of appeal and dispute settlement; 7° to serve as an appellate body for decisions made by the Bureau of the National Council Board; 8° to approve the budget, the long-term planning and annual action plan; 9° to support all activities and initiatives designed to promote the knowledge of Rwanda’s residents in the pharmacy profession.

provisions.chapter: Chapter III – Competence and responsibilities of the organs of the Council
provisions.title: Article 18 – Responsibilities of the Bureau of the National Council Board
provisions.content: The Bureau of the National Council Board shall have the following responsibilities: 1° to do its utmost to ensure the smooth running of activities of the Council and those of its Committees; 2° to update the Register of members of the Council; 3° to implement instructions, regulations and decisions of the National Council Board; 4° to put an end to any act, contract or statutes to which a pharmacist may be a party but which include clauses that undermine the principles of pharmacy ethics; 5° to report to relevant authorities acts of illegal practice of the pharmacy profession that come to its knowledge and take disciplinary measures accordingly; 6° to impose disciplinary sanctions for professional misconduct committed by a pharmacist as well as serious misconduct committed outside the course of professional practice but that are likely to undermine the honor and dignity of the pharmacy profession; 7° to enforce any disciplinary measure taken by the organs of the Council responsible for the ethics of pharmacists; 8° to hire and dismiss staff of the Council and determine their duties and set their remuneration in accordance with the relevant laws; 9° to perform any other duty falling within its responsibilities as may be deemed necessary by the National Council Board.

provisions.chapter: Chapter III – Competence and responsibilities of the organs of the Council
provisions.title: Article 19 – Training
provisions.content: The National Council Board shall put in place a training system for each pharmacist to enhance his/her knowledge on an ongoing basis. Each pharmacist must enhance his/her knowledge and be subject to a knowledge and performance assessment.

provisions.chapter: Chapter III – Competence and responsibilities of the organs of the Council
provisions.title: Article 20 – Knowledge assessment
provisions.content: The National Council Board shall put in place a knowledge assessment system, organs responsible for conducting such assessment and monitor its conduct. The internal rules and regulations of the Council shall determine modalities for conducting the assessment. Each pharmacist must obtain the minimum score as determined by the National Council Board for him/her to be duly authorized to practice the pharmacy profession.

provisions.chapter: Chapter III – Competence and responsibilities of the organs of the Council
provisions.title: Article 21 – Post-knowledge assessment measures
provisions.content: When a pharmacist fails to obtain the required score, the National Council Board shall take one or more of the following measures: 1° to subject him/her to a specific ongoing training program; 2° to require him/her to sit for a written examination; 3° to require him/her to work under the supervision of another pharmacist or to impose him/her some restrictions; 4° to remove his/her name from the Register of members of the Council.

provisions.chapter: Chapter IV – Functioning of the organs of the Council
provisions.title: Article 22 – Chairperson of the National Council Board
provisions.content: The activities of the National Council Board shall be led by the Chairperson of the National Council Board and, in his/her absence, by the Deputy Chairperson.

provisions.chapter: Chapter IV – Functioning of the organs of the Council
provisions.title: Article 23 – Meetings of the National Council Board
provisions.content: Modalities for preparing the meetings of the National Council Board, procedures for taking decisions and sanctions for absence from meetings shall be determined by the Internal Rules and Regulations of the Council.

provisions.chapter: Chapter IV – Functioning of the organs of the Council
provisions.title: Article 24 – Invitation of a resource person in the meetings of the National Council Board
provisions.content: In order to carry out its responsibilities, the National Council Board may invite to its meetings any person whose opinion may be useful for the consideration of a particular item on the agenda. The invited person cannot participate in vote or discussions on other items on the agenda.

provisions.chapter: Chapter IV – Functioning of the organs of the Council
provisions.title: Article 25 – Transmission of the register of pharmacists members of the Council
provisions.content: Before 31 st July of each year, the Bureau of the National Council Board shall transmit to the Minister in charge of health the Register of members of the Council drawn up on 30 June of the same year, which register must be published. Any deletion or removal of a pharmacist from the register shall be notified to the authority referred to above and must be published.

provisions.chapter: Chapter IV – Functioning of the organs of the Council
provisions.title: Article 26 – Permanent Secretariat
provisions.content: For the Council to carry out its mission, the Bureau of the National Council Board shall be assisted in its daily activities by a Permanent Secretariat. Responsibilities and the functioning of the Permanent Secretariat of the Council shall be determined by the internal rules and regulations of the Council.

provisions.chapter: Chapter V – Code of ethics and disciplinary measures
provisions.title: Article 27 – Disciplinary measures
provisions.content: Disciplinary measures that may be taken by the organs of the Council against pharmacists shall be as follows: 1. warning; 2. reprimand; 3. temporary suspension of practice for a period not exceeding twelve (12) months; 4. removal from the register of members of the Council. Each disciplinary measure provided above shall be notified to the Minister in charge of health. Before any disciplinary measure is taken against a pharmacist, he/she must be given the opportunity to be heard by the organ with the power to impose such a measure against him/her.

provisions.chapter: Chapter V – Code of ethics and disciplinary measures
provisions.title: Article 28 – Consequences of temporary suspension
provisions.content: A pharmacist who is subject to a disciplinary measure of temporary suspension of practice of the pharmacy profession shall be deprived of his/her right to vote and be elected in the organs of the Council for a period of three (3) years.

provisions.chapter: Chapter V – Code of ethics and disciplinary measures
provisions.title: Article 29 – Automatic removal from office
provisions.content: A pharmacist elected on any organ of the Council shall be subject to automatic removal from office if: 1° he/she is subject to a disciplinary measure of temporary suspension; 2° he/she was removed from the Register of members of the Council; 3° he/she has been definitively sentenced to a term of imprisonment equal to or exceeding six (6) months.

provisions.chapter: Chapter V – Code of ethics and disciplinary measures
provisions.title: Article 30 – Non-discrimination
provisions.content: No disciplinary measure shall be imposed against a pharmacist by the organs of the Council on the grounds of any form of discrimination.

provisions.chapter: Chapter V – Code of ethics and disciplinary measures
provisions.title: Article 31 – Professional secrecy
provisions.content: All pharmacists and members of the organs of the Council shall be bound by professional secrecy for any information gained from their duties or they acquire in the course of performance of their duties even after they cease to perform such duties. The same shall apply to any person who, in whatever capacity, participates in the functioning of the Council. The breach of professional secrecy shall be punishable in accordance with the provisions of the Penal Code.

provisions.chapter: Chapter V – Code of ethics and disciplinary measures
provisions.title: Article 32 – Prosecution of a pharmacist practicing without being registered in the register of the Council or while on the suspension
provisions.content: Any pharmacist who practices the pharmacy profession without being registered in the register of the Council as well as a pharmacist who practices while he/she is subject to temporary or permanent suspension shall be brought before competent courts of law. The same shall apply to any employer of a pharmacist referred to under Paragraph One of this Article.

provisions.chapter: Chapter V – Code of ethics and disciplinary measures
provisions.title: Article 33 – Disciplinary proceedings
provisions.content: Disciplinary proceedings relating to the profession against a pharmacist shall not prevent: 1° legal proceedings in criminal courts; 2° legal proceedings before civil courts; 3° disciplinary proceedings before the superior in the administrative hierarchy.

provisions.chapter: Chapter VI – Disciplinary procedures and appeal
provisions.title: Article 34 – Disciplinary action by the National Council Board
provisions.content: The National Council Board shall institute the disciplinary action against a pharmacist on its own initiative or upon request by any other interested person.

provisions.chapter: Chapter VI – Disciplinary procedures and appeal
provisions.title: Article 35 – Temporary suspension of a pharmacist by the Bureau of the National Council Board
provisions.content: Pending the decision of the National Council Board which must be taken within one month, the Bureau of the National Council Board may temporarily suspend a pharmacist suspected of having committed a serious misconduct punishable by temporary suspension or removal from the Register of the members of the Council. Without prejudice to the provisions of the Paragraph One of this Article, a pharmacist who is subject to removal from the Register of members of the Council for gross misconduct may apply for re-registration on the register after three (3) years. The National Council Board which had taken such a measure shall reconsider it to make a final decision.

provisions.chapter: Chapter VI – Disciplinary procedures and appeal
provisions.title: Article 36 – Measure taken against a pharmacist in absentia
provisions.content: A pharmacist against whom a measure was taken in absentia may file an opposition to such an action within fifteen (15) days of notification. When the person who has filed an opposition fails to appear once again without good reason, he/she can no longer file a new opposition.

provisions.chapter: Chapter VI – Disciplinary procedures and appeal
provisions.title: Article 37 – Appeal
provisions.content: The appeal shall be made in writing and sent to the Permanent Secretariat of the National Council Board. Such an appeal may be made within thirty (30) days from the date of its notification either by the concerned pharmacist or by the Minister in charge of health or any other interested person. The appeal against a measure shall lead to the suspension of its enforcement. The decision of the National Council Board shall be notified to the concerned person by means of a registered mail or hand-delivered to him/her or through any other means of communication against acknowledgment of receipt within thirty (30) days from the date the decision was taken.

provisions.chapter: Chapter VII – Property of the Council
provisions.title: Article 38 – Sources of the property and modalities for its management
provisions.content: The property of the Council shall be comprised of movables and immovables. It shall come from the following sources: 1° members’ contributions; 2° subsidies, donations and bequests; 3° investments of the Council; 4° proceeds from services rendered by the Council.

provisions.chapter: Chapter VII – Property of the Council
provisions.title: Article 39 – Annual contribution
provisions.content: The National Council Board shall determine annually the amount of contribution to be paid by each person practicing the pharmacy profession to the Provincial Council of the place of his/her practice. It also determines the quota to be paid to the National Council Board.

provisions.chapter: Chapter VII – Property of the Council
provisions.title: Article 40 – Management of the property
provisions.content: The National Council Board shall manage the property of the Council and may organize and subsidy non-profit activities designed to promote pharmacy profession.

provisions.chapter: Chapter VIII – Transitional and final provisions
provisions.title: Article 41 – General Assembly
provisions.content: Within ninety (90) days from the publication of this Law in the Official Gazette of the Republic of Rwanda, the Minister in charge of health shall convene the first General Assembly which shall elect a provisional Committee responsible for preparing the putting in place of the organs of the Council within three (3) months.

provisions.chapter: Chapter VIII – Transitional and final provisions
provisions.title: Article 42 – Code of ethics
provisions.content: The Code of ethics of the pharmacy profession shall be determined by an Order of the Minister in charge of health.

provisions.chapter: Chapter VIII – Transitional and final provisions
provisions.title: Article 43 – Drafting, consideration and adoption of this Law
provisions.content: This Law was drafted in English, considered and adopted in Kinyarwanda.

provisions.chapter: Chapter VIII – Transitional and final provisions
provisions.title: Article 44 – Repealing provision
provisions.content: All prior legal provisions contrary to this Law are hereby repealed.

provisions.chapter: Chapter VIII – Transitional and final provisions
provisions.title: Article 45 – Commencement
provisions.content: This Law shall come into force on the date of its publication in the Official Gazette of the Republic of Rwanda.
